comment: It response incomplete and stop prematurely.

Shortly

  1. Sometimes it's stuck. In obvious cases, it does not suggest anything or suggests by 10-20 symbols
  2. It starts hallucinating. Typical case: I have some code and I need to place "if" before it. So, I type "if " and then Copilot write my rest code with indentation. But this suggestion is not equal to my original code. For example, I had 2 variables: viewer and viewed, and it replaced "viewer" with "viewed".
Best plugin of this month 1.5.57-243. All previous updates were too buggy that Agent mode was not even able to edit simple codes properly.

Promising at the beginning.... now it's sloppy at best, unworkable sometimes!

  • "You may not include more than 128 tools in your request." in agent mode: can't handle much more than the GitHub MCP, if you want to add another one, you will have to disable MCPs not to cross this low limit.
  • Removes the GitHub MCP server the integration configuration from the mcp.json /Users//.config/github-copilot/intellij/mcp.json file (Mac) so you have to add it again and again (even during sessions).
  • High memory usage

Overall those simple issues make it impractical at best in agentic mode.
After the update, the plugin is much better. Chat and inline chat now work correctly.
NES is silly
The plugin breaks down and slows down the IDE very much

When updating from version 1.5.52-243 to 1.5.56-243, I get the error message: 'Plugin “GitHub Copilot” download or installation failed.' It is no longer possible to update to new versions from version 1.5.52 onwards.

As soon as a chat window is open, the plugin uses 100% CPU. All processes like syntax checks etc. that Webstorm usually does won't run anymore (or very slowly) until closing the chat window. This is probably due to Copilot using all compute power for itself. In agent mode, the newest version makes changes in files, checks for errors and then deletes everything without noticing. Mostly unusable in this state.

This plugin makes my IDE unusable. Multiple times a day, my IDE completely grinds to a halt & I have to force quit and restart it. I have to force quit multiple java processes after closing too otherwise they continue to exist and eat up resources. Even before the IDE issues, the syntax & error feedback cycle that i find cruical for fast feedback when programming freezes completely whenever the chat toolwindow is open. I'm not even running into RAM or CPU issues. I'm on an Macbook M3 Pro; activity monitor shows the rest of the computer is fine, but sometimes I cannot even write code!
Slow syntax highlighting
Completely unusable right now with gpt-5. Can't complete the simplest programming tasks. Can't even write code that compiles.

Really poor integration with WebStorm. Agent mode generates its suggestions for the file, but then after checking for errors it just clears everything and leaves an empty file in the end, while thinking that it did the job.

My initial review score was 3 but now it i 1 because the plugin seems to be completely broken now. As soon as I'm installing it the IDE becomes unusable slow. You sometimes have to wait more than a minute until syntax highlighting becomes updated and wrong stuff is displayed everywhere.
In the new version, the "@" feature no longer works (e.g., @github, @askStackoverflow). Is this a bug?

Installing this plugin for PyCharm Community Edition, the GitHub Copilot Chat window frequently produces incomplete answers to prompts, like a character window is hit or the model freezes halfway through its responses. This is pretty frustrating, and it seems I'm not alone, there's a reddit thread on /r/pycharm with other users complaining about this too.

Overall, the plugin works perfectly — smooth integration and no issues at all with Copilot itself.

The only limitation I’ve found is with the MCP configuration: currently, IntelliJ only supports a single global mcp.json at

~/.config/github-copilot/intellij/mcp.json

This means all IntelliJ instances share the same MCP servers, which is not ideal when working on multiple projects with different needs.

👉 It would be great if the plugin could first check for an mcp.json at the project level, and if not found, fall back to the global config (this is how it already works in VS Code).

Other than that, the plugin is excellent — thanks for the great work!
When switched from free account to enterprise one, vision stopped working. I have preview features enabled.
For now the "Agent" mode is almost completely useless for more complex tasks, but the "Ask" mode is quite OK. This thing is still quite cheap, compared to, for example Junie.
This is not a copilot its a nightmare! It's not able to do anything! Why are we paying for it again?
It's so laughably inept. Loss of context, cant ready attached files, goes off on tangents.

Genuinely horrendous implementation of Agentic AI. It's rare that Copilot doesn't corrupt the file entirely when I ask for a simple edit like moving a chunk of code out into a helper function, and it's so slow anyway that I may as well do it myself. VS Code's version is significantly better, which is saying something considering it is generally considered to not be that great. Please fix this plugin, I want my Jetbrains IDEs to have a good AI coding copilot!

Main thing - API keys are forgotten every 10-15 minutes, It's unworkable to have to keep entering these THIS OFTEN.

Terrible UI, to begin with - settings are hidden in 4 different locations.

The website redirects to stack overflow for questions - which get locked because stack overflow admins don't want the questions and redirect back to the plugin maker.

Apart from this plugin consumes huge amount of RAM as everybody already mention that causes many issues like slow syntax highlighting and linting. The agent mode feature I once found that it give me only suggestion chunk and removed the existing code, so I found methods without the enclosing class. LOL. I try the vscode plugin it worked so much better.

THE PERSON MAKING THIS PLUGIN SHOULD BE FIRED!

Developer of this plugin, if you read this: YOU ARE A VERY BAD PERSON. Because of you, work stopped, prompts are disappearing, random errors keep popping up.
Crashes my IDE

It has some ups and downs. It is a good assistant for very simple tasks. For example when adding missing unit tests for existing code. Or when working in a codebase with a lots of boilerplate you can save some time typing repetitive stuff.

It also can become handy when it comes to writing generic code with complex expressions or when you are new to a language or framework an want to know how do I ...

The downside is, on more advanced code it seems to become very sluggish. Or when you are refactoring. Even small changes are making the IDE features like compile error detection extremely sluggish. It sometimes takes more than a minute before correct code is now seen as correct by the IDE. It that cases it is slowing me down because I'm double checking correct code or simple wait until my screen is no longer messed up with false error messages.

Code completition is not yet ready for production I would say. Sometimes it makes a match by chance which is surprisingly good, but in most cases it is simply garbage and worse than what the IDE offers by default. And also it feels laggy compared to the build in code completition.

Version 1.5.52-243 4 stars

  • Slightly clunky UI
  • Agent mode works really well

Version 1.5.56-243 0 stars

  • Good improvements to the UI
  • Agent mode doesn't work at all. It regularly places code in the wrong place causing the entire file to break. It often deletes the code it wrote when trying to fix the errors in the code it wrote, then tells you its done. Completely useless.

PLEASE RESTORE CREDITS!!!

NEW UPDATE IS INCREDIBLY BUGGY!
An error occurred while processing your request. Please try again later.
The user experience is terrible. The normal operation on vscode will cause code dislocation in webstorm, agent generates blank pages and other problems, and there is no latest version of the model.

My experience has been hot and cold. It seems I'm either overjoyed with the results or reject it all and do it myself. I still talk about a transformation Copilot excelled at by taking a barely structured node script and turning it into a lambda, service functions, serverless file configurations, and tests and I only have to change one thing, which was the name of a permission. Saved me nearly a day's effort. Other sessions have been comically bad even though I could not think of a better prompt or other context. I have not witnessed the widespread UI glitches in WebStorm but I am avoiding updating the plugin per recent warnings.

I see people downvoting anyone who claims a positive experience. I have had some while using the plugin in WebStorm. Sorry for that.

DO NOT UPDATE

how can I downgrade? it's basically wasting my credits and generating empty files
DO NOT UPDATE TO NEW VERSION!!!
Slows code analysis down brutally. Causes IntelliJ to leave code red - and when you cut and paste it's magically not red any longer. It's extremely under tested and seems to have abysmal performance.

I’ve been trying to use this Copilot plugin for a while, and the experience has been very disappointing compared to VS Code.

It frequently consumes 50%+ of my CPU for hours without any clear reason, which makes the whole system sluggish.

As a result, the IDE itself becomes noticeably slower and less responsive, even when I’m not actively using Copilot features.

The integration feels poorly executed – nowhere near the smooth and efficient experience you get in VS Code. Honestly, it almost feels intentional, as if the goal was to push people back to VS Code instead of offering a decent alternative.

Overall, the plugin drags down productivity instead of boosting it. Definitely not worth enabling in its current state.
Just horrible, how can these hige bugs still be present for several versions

Please add Ukrainian natural language, which is available in your direct competitor — PhpStorm’s native AI assistant, if you want me to continue my subscription. Please add the ability to configure MCP for an individual project.

When you start the IDE and the plugin, the first thing it does is log some exception in the exception of IntelliJ It's really not clear when it's doing something and when it's not. Some times, it'll log an exception, then the font in the IDE will be changed.

I'd say for it's defense that I'm using it while using the Gateway to connect to a remote dev env. Which is not issue either on it's side....
因为这个没法正常用，我只能接着用vscode了。 实在是太糟糕了。
I suspect that this plugin was developed entirely under AI-driven management, without rigorous testing.

DO NOT UPDATE TO NEW VERSION!!!

Losing content after response generation,just terrible

There are two things I regret most in life. One is not buying Google stock at $140, and the other is pressing the update button on Copilot. I truly regret pressing the update button with my finger. Users are not bug testers. Please test properly before releasing the official version. If this bug is fixed, I will never press the update button again.
terrible, losing file content during response generation

Will not complete code blocks. Fails part way through again and again. Says it "tested" the code for errors when it removes whole sections of code that were out of scope.

This WAS a really good product. The last few releases have made it unusable. Probably 75% of the time it either does not complete a code block, causing me to back out the changes, or it's memory usage crashes Android studio.

I am considering cancelling my pro subscription in favor of something else. It is beginning to waste unrecoverable amounts of time.
The chat cannot be deleted due to an error in three consecutive versions. When will you hire your first QA?

The Copilot team intentionally makes this plugin so bad to drive people to their VSCode product. I wasn't sure about this conspiracy until they deliberately ignored my issue report in their GitHub repo for half a month while their automation bot said they would respond within 2 days.
Last update make me wonder who tested it.
Last 2 months there are no ability to use this peace of sht. Problems with login, problems with rendering code in window. Now it is not show any interface at all

1. Bad performance - memory leaks all over.
  2. Bad IDE integration - after latest update chat isn't loading, before that it was barely usable, code prediction only gets in the way, 99% of suggestions are irrelevant. Inline agent is awkward to use.
  3. ANY free GPT thingy gives better results than PAYED Copilot.
